topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Working with HPE 3PAR StoreServ

body.p: The StoreServ option allows you to configure HPE 3PAR StoreServ as storage. HPE 3PAR StoreServ is also referred to as 3PAR. Before you start working with StoreServ, ensure that it is accessible from the undercloud and you have all the required details to register the device using Sirius service.

You can configure a 3PAR device by using the undercloud Horizon dashboard (recommended) or the Sirius client. This page describes the different tasks that you can perform using the StoreServ option in the undercloud Horizon dashboard.

section.title: Before you begin
section.p: Before you start working with 3PAR StoreServ, ensure that the following prerequisites have been fulfilled:

ol.li: HPE Helion Cloud is deployed
The HPE 3PAR StoreServ device is accessible from the undercloud.
The HPE 3PAR StoreServ device (running operating system v 3.1.3 or later) is accessible by the Compute nodes and Cinder running in the overcloud.
Common Provisioning Groups (CPGs) are created for HPE 3PAR StoreServ

section.title: Register a 3PAR device
section.p: To register the device using the undercloud Horizon dashboard, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click Register StoreServ displayed on the top right corner of the page to display the Register 3PAR StoreServ dialog box.

In the dialog box, do the following:
In the Name box, enter the name for the 3PAR array.
In the IP Address box, enter the IP address of the 3PAR Web Service API Server.
In the Username box, enter the user name of the 3PAR super user.
In the Password box, enter the password of the 3PAR super user.
In the Port box, enter the Port for the 3PAR Web Service API service.
In the SAN IP box, enter the valid 3PAR IP address of the SAN controller for SSH access to the array.
In the SAN username box, enter the valid 3PAR user name of the SAN controller for SSH access to the array.
In the SAN password box, enter the valid 3PAR password of the SAN controller for SSH access to the array.
From the Device Type drop-down list, select the device type. For example: FC, iSCSI. By default, the device type is FC.
If the device type is selected as iSCSI and more than one iSCSI IP addresses need to be specified, use a comma separated list for the same. You can also specify the ports alongwith the IP addresses (separated by colon), if required.
For example:
10.1.2.200,10.1.2.100:3380,10.1.2.102
Click Done to save the details.
On successful registration, the 3PAR device is added and is listed as the registered StoreServ.

section.title: Edit a 3PAR StoreServ
section.p: To edit the details of a StoreServ, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click Edit StoreServ.
Make the required changes.
Click Done to save the changes.

section.title: Unregister a 3PAR StoreServ

p.note: Before you unregister the StoreServ, you need to unregister the CPG and remove the backend. Once the 3PAR is unregistered, neither the CPGs nor the volumes from these CPGs are accessible from the cloud.

section.p: Use this option to unregister a StoreServ.

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click the More drop-down list against the StoreServ that you want to unregister and select Unregister StoreServ. A confirmation box is displayed.
Click Unregister StoreServ to unregister, or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Unregister multiple 3PAR StoreServs
section.p: Use this option to unregister multiple StoreServs using a single command.

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click the checkbox displayed against the Name column to select all the StoreServs.
Click Unregister StoreServ to unregister the StoreServs.A confirmation box is displayed.
Click Unregister StoreServ to unregister or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Register 3PAR StoreServ Common Provisioning Groups (CPGs)
section.p: Once you register the 3PAR device, choose the CPGs for your cloud. CPG (Common Provisioning Group) is a fundamental unit that can be configured as a Cinder backend. A single HPE 3PAR StoreServ may have multiple CPGs. You can choose and allocate them to the cloud as a per your requirement.

p.note: Only registered CPG(s) can be configured as a storage backend for Cinder.

section.p: To register the CPGs, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed with the list of StoreServs.

Click the More drop-down list against the StoreServ for which you want to register CPG and select Register CPG. The Register CPG page is displayed with a list of CPGs that are present in the selected 3PAR array in the Available CPG box.
OR
Click the StoreServ device name for which you want to register the CPG. The Common Provisioning Groups page is displayed with a list of CPGs.
Click Register CPG. The Register CPG page is displayed with a list of CPGs that are present in the selected 3PAR array in the Available CPG box.
Select the desired CPG(s) from the Available CPG box list.
Click → to move the CPG(s)to the Selected CPG(s) box. The CPG is displayed in the Selected CPG(s) box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available CPG box to select all the CPGs .
(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected CPG box to move all the CPGs back to the Available CPG(s) or select the CPG(s) and click ← to move them back.
Click Register to register the CPG.
To check the status of CPG registration, in the HPE StoreServ page, click the device name to display the Common Provisioning Groups page. The selected CPG displays as registered.

section.title: Edit a CPG
section.note: You cannot edit a CPG that is in 'Reserved' state. Ensure that you enter a CPG name that already exists on the 3PAR device when you edit the CPG details.
section.p: To edit a CPG, do the following:

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed with the list of StoreServs.
Click the StoreServ device name for which you want to register CPG. The Common Provisioning Groups page is displayed with a list of CPGs.
Click Edit CPG against the CPG that you want to edit. The Update CPG Details dialog box is displayed.
Make the required changes.
Click Done to save the changes or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Unregister a CPG
section.note: When you unregister a CPG, the volumes from this CPG backend will no longer be available through Cinder. Ensure you detach all relevant volumes and remove the backend associated with the CPG before unregistering.

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then click Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click the StoreServ device name for which you want to unregister CPG. The Common Provisioning Groups page is displayed with a list of CPGs.
Click the More drop-down list against the CPG you want to unregister and select Unregister CPG. A confirmation dialog box is displayed.
Click Unregister CPG to unregister or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Unregister multiple CPGs
section.p: Use this option to unregister multiple CPGs using a single command.

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click the StoreServ device name for which you want to unregister the CPG. The Common Provisioning Groups page is displayed with a list of CPGs.
Click the checkbox displayed against the Name column to select all the CPGs.
Click Unregister CPGs to unregister the CPGs.A confirmation box is displayed.
Click Unregister CPGs to unregister or click Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: View CPG configuration
section.p: Use this option to view the CPG configuration (as defined in OpenStack Configuration Manual for HPE 3PAR Cinder Block Storage Volume Driver).

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud Horizon dashboard.
From the left panel, click the Resources tab and then Storage to display the overview page.
Select the StoreServ option to activate it. The HPE StoreServ page is displayed.
Click the StoreServ device name for which you want to view CPG configuration. The Common Provisioning Groups page is displayed with a list of CPGs.
Click the More drop-down list against the CPG for which you want to view the configuration. The configuration is displayed in a dialog box.
Click Close to close and return to the Common Provisioning Groups page.
